text.p: The following are the main stories from Tuesday morning's German newspapers:
- Lafontaine - Tax reform must not be delayed
- Rexrodt - Airbus must stand up to Boeing
- Sharp profits on markets after stability pact
- Decision over eastern shipyards by April
- Markets unified and positive over stability pact
- IFO boss sees boost through slow-down in internal weaknesses
- Greens deputy goes over to CDU
- Greens' deputy Lengsfeld moves to CDU
- Genetically changed soya beans harmless says government
- Modrow sentenced to probation for perjury
- Rexrodt - U.S. air merger is challenge for Airbus
- Van Miert wants to give billion marks to eastern shipyards
- Italy remains cheapest holiday destination in Alps
- Kohl speaks up for just solution in East Timor
- IFO expects better economic growth but more unemployment
- German trade union federation criticises Dubin decisions as lip-service to unemployment
